comment: easiest class. she puts out material to read or watch every week. sometimes there are graded discussion posts on the material. everything was participation grades besides a final group project and one quiz. final group project was the only thing that was iffy because it is a five page paper with a group of around 8.
One of the best general ed classes I took. Very easy A definitely take her.

Online was perfect. This class was so easy I would 100% recommend taking it. You do end up doing group work which sucks when it's online. But the class is so easy if you get a bad group it's annoying but doesn't matter. It's about one discussion a week and hardly any test. Nothing on lockdown browser.

She took an eternity to grade anything and basically everything was group projects with random people online, which was lowkey annoying but in the end she grades so easily its basically all completion and I ended with a easy A. Definitely worth it just to get the class credit.

Had one Group project and several group and individual discussion post due. Final paper due at the semester. Overall the class felt unorganised probably cause this is her first semester. She was a lenient grader. Assignments and Quizzes were easy and quiz were based off the reading. Also extended deadlines for assignments.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: The course itself is not difficult, she made it intriguing and fun! Very group project heavy except for the final. Lots of extra credit given and super easy, as long as you get the work done. Doesn't respond to emails that often and grades do take a while to go in. Nice professor and I enjoyed the course! Very lenient grader as well!
This is an online class but she does not respond to emails. A lot of group work and takes a long time to grade assignments
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Online Savvy
